docs.lead_paragraph: MR. BROWNELL'S admirable little monograph "Standards" was, in substance, read last Autumn be fore the American Academy. It has something of the flavor of what in his journalistic days he would have recognized as an "obituary," and somewhat--in its seriousness...

docs.lead_paragraph: ONE of the most obvious questions to ask an author is "What effect, spiritual and intellectual, is the war having on the world? " Probably every living author has been asked this, and few have responded with any particularly interesting statement.

headline.main: Stevenson's 'Unhealthy Optimism' Fades in War; Margaret Widdemer Says Neurotic Invalid Was the Progenitor of 'Pollyanna' Idea and Founded School of Wall-Motto Philosophy

docs.snippet: ONE of the most obvious questions to ask an author is "What effect, spiritual and intellectual, is the war having on the world? " Probably every living author has been  asked this, and few have responded with any particularly interesting statement.
